Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Purr \Purr\, n. The low murmuring sound made by a cat; pur. See {Pur}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Purr \Purr\, v. i. & t. To murmur as a cat. See {Pur}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pur \Pur\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Purred}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Purring}.] [Of imitative origin; cf. Prov. G. purren.] To utter a low, murmuring, continued sound, as a cat does when pleased. [Written also {purr}.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pur \Pur\, n. The low, murmuring sound made by a cat to express contentment or pleasure. [Written also {purr}.] [1913 Webster]

purr n : a low vibrating sound typical of a contented cat v 1: make a soft swishing sound; "the motor whirred"; "the car engine purred" [syn: {whizz}, {whiz}, {whirr}, {whir}, {birr}] 2: indicate pleasure by purring; characteristic of cats [syn: {make vibrant sounds}]
